page.title: 05TRAVELLING TO WORK
page.content: Fifty families were surveyed to find out how far they travel to work.Our 12km squares has three villages - Garsdon, Charlton and Lea. Only 30 people surveyed work within the area. This is mainly because the land is used for grazing cattle and growing crops. So the parents who work in the area are mainly farmers. Most of thoses asked are employed in Malmesbury. Years ago most fathers worked on a farm and lived on one. Results of this survey show this is no longer the case. One father even travels to Nailsworth for his job and he lives in Charlton. The fathers travel further than the mothers. The fathers travel to Chippenham, Tetbury, Cirencester, Bristol, Dursley, Lynham, Calne and a few other places.
